trial_identification.studytitle: An Efficacy and Safety Study for Rivaroxaban in Patients With Acute Coronary Syndrome
trial_identification.scientifictitle: A Randomized, Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled, Event-Driven Multicenter Study to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of Rivaroxaban in Subjects With a Recent Acute Coronary Syndrome

conditioncode.conditioncode2: Research that is not of generic health relevance and not applicable to specific health categories listed above
Diseases of the vasculature and circulation including the lymphatic system

interventions.interventions:
Treatment: drugs - Rivaroxaban 2.5 mg Treatment: drugs - Rivaroxaban 5 mg Treatment: drugs - Placebo Treatment: drugs - Standard of care
Experimental: Rivaroxaban 2.5 mg bid - One 2.5 mg rivaroxaban tablet twice daily for up to 6 months
Experimental: Rivaroxaban 5 mg bid - One 5 mg rivaroxaban tablet twice daily for up to 6 months
Placebo Comparator: Placebo - One placebo tablet twice daily for up to 6 months
Treatment: drugs: Rivaroxaban 2.5 mg One tablet twice daily
Treatment: drugs: Rivaroxaban 5 mg One tablet twice daily
Treatment: drugs: Placebo One placebo tablet twice daily
Treatment: drugs: Standard of care

primaryOutcome.outcome: The Percentage of Patients With the Composite Endpoint of Cardiovascular Death, Myocardial Infarction, or Stroke - The percentage of patients with the first occurrence of the composite of death, myocardial infarction, or stroke. The statistical analysis was based on the time from randomization to the first occurrence of the event while on treatment.
primaryOutcome.timepoint: From the time of randomization (Day 1) up to completion of the treatment phase (Month 6)

secondaryOutcome.outcome: The Percentage of Patients With the Composite of All Cause Death, Myocardial Infarction, or Stroke - The percentage of patients with the first occurrence of the composite endpoint. The statistical analysis was based on the time from randomization to the first occurrence of the event while on treatment.
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: From the time of randomization (Day 1) up to completion of the treatment phase (Month 6)

secondaryOutcome.outcome: The Percentage of Patients With the Composite of Cardiovascular Death, Myocardial Infarction, Ischemic Stroke, or TIMI Major Bleeding Event Not Associated With Coronary Artery Bypass Graft Surgery - The percentage of patients with the first occurrence of the composite endpoint. The statistical analysis was based on the time from randomization to the first occurrence of the event while on treatment.
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: From the time of randomization (Day 1) up to completion of the treatment phase (Month 6)

secondaryOutcome.outcome: The Percentage of Patients With the Composite of Cardiovascular Death, Myocardial Infarction, Stroke, or Severe Recurrent Ischemia Requiring Revascularization - The percentage of patients with the first occurrence of the composite endpoint. The statistical analysis was based on the time from randomization to the first occurrence of the event while on treatment.
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: From the time of randomization (Day 1) up to completion of the treatment phase (Month 6)

secondaryOutcome.outcome: The Percentage of Patients With the Composite of Cardiovascular Death, Myocardial Infarction, Stroke, or Severe Recurrent Ischemia Leading to Hospitalization - The percentage of patients with the first occurrence of the composite endpoint. The statistical analysis was based on the time from randomization to the first occurrence of the event while on treatment.
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: From the time of randomization (Day 1) up to completion of the treatment phase (Month 6)

eligibility.inclusivecriteria:
- Patients must be currently receiving aspirin therapy alone or in combination with a thienopyridine per national or local dosing recommendation
- Have been hospitalized for symptoms suggestive of acute coronary syndrome that lasted at least 10 minutes at rest and occurred 48 hours or less before going to the hospital
eligibility.exclusivecriteria:
- Any condition that, in the opinion of the investigator, contraindicates anticoagulant therapy or would have an unacceptable risk of bleeding
- Need for continued anticoagulant therapy
- Significant renal impairment or known significant liver disease

sponsorship.primarysponsorname: Johnson & Johnson Pharmaceutical Research & Development, L.L.C.

ethicsAndSummary.summary: The purpose of this study is to determine whether rivaroxaban in addition to standard care reduces the risk of the composite of cardiovascular death, myocardial infarction, or stroke in patients with a recent acute coronary syndrome compared with placebo.

contact.name: Johnson & Johnson Pharmaceutical Research & Development, L.L. C. Clinical Trial
contact.address: Johnson & Johnson Pharmaceutical Research & Development, L.L.C.
